name: Bus Glue (story-driven)
intent: Start like clean mix glue and slowly drift into cinematic wash so students can see when each block jumps in.

waypoints.label: Anchored intro
waypoints.why: Show the dry bus plus a polite width bloom; limiter barely working so you can hear the tilt and air shifts first.

waypoints.label: Bus glue mid-game
waypoints.why: Punch a little harder—watch transient sensor narrow the sides on hits while limiter catches cymbal spikes.

waypoints.label: Cinematic wash
waypoints.why: Sides and air bloom; limiter link flipped to Mid/Side in-class so students can hear the difference in how the tail breathes.

name: Limiter link lab
intent: Rapid toggle between Linked and Mid/Side detection while watching limiter telemetry to teach how stereo coupling feels.

waypoints.label: Linked safety
waypoints.why: Both channels take the same hit—shows students the safest, mono-loyal guardrail before they start biasing the detector.

waypoints.label: Mid/Side breath
waypoints.why: Flip to Mid/Side and listen for side tails breathing while the center stays pinned; perfect for talking about coupling philosophy.
